commentBody:
The problem with replay in the NFL context is that it can be initiated by the teams concerned - the challenge flag - and by the officials themselves. All scores have to be reviewed, for instance. It's made a overly long, disjointed telecast even less tolerable.
In contrast, baseball has only the team challenge, and reviews are handled quickly by experts in a studio with the best technology. And we all benefit from rarely seeing the futile, and often degrading, spectacle of a manager arguing calls with the umpire. I think baseball has the technology about right.
